text:
🚀 Exciting Milestone: Google Prompting Essentials Certification!

I am thrilled to announce that I have successfully completed the Google Prompting Essentials course by Google and Coursera! 🎓

In this course, I gained invaluable skills in the art of effective prompting, learning to design clear and specific instructions for Generative AI tools. With the ability to use AI to simplify everyday tasks—from drafting emails and brainstorming ideas to analyzing data and building presentations—I now feel empowered to leverage AI for greater efficiency and productivity.

Here are some key takeaways:
✅ Mastered the 5-step framework for writing effective prompts
✅ Applied advanced techniques like prompt chaining and multimodal prompting to tackle complex tasks
✅ Designed AI agents for role-playing conversations and obtaining expert feedback
✅ Learned to evaluate and iterate prompts for the best possible results
✅ Gained the ability to use AI responsibly, ensuring bias-free and accurate outputs

This certification enhances my expertise in AI and prompt engineering, which will be invaluable as I continue to build on my skills and contribute to innovative AI-driven solutions. I'm excited to apply this knowledge in future projects and explore new ways AI can optimize processes across industries.

A big thank you to the Google team for this well-structured course and hands-on learning experience. 📚

Looking forward to connecting with professionals and businesses interested in the transformative power of AI! Let’s discuss how we can apply these techniques to drive success in our respective fields. 🤖✨

#Google #GenerativeAI #MachineLearning #PromptEngineering #CareerGrowth #TechInnovation #AItools #AIresponsibility

🚀 Excited to share my personal project: Saral's Code Reviewer! 🚀

As developers, we know the importance of efficient and thorough code reviews. That’s why I built Saral's Code Reviewer, an AI-powered tool designed to enhance the review process and make it faster, more accurate, and more insightful. This tool leverages Generative AI to help developers improve code quality and efficiency.

🔍 **Key Features of Saral's Code Reviewer:**
✅ **Overall Quality Summary:** Get a comprehensive overview of your code's health and quality.
✅ **Bug Identification and Error Handling:** Automatically detect bugs and potential issues, suggesting quick fixes.
✅ **Correct Code in Multiple Languages:**
- **Python:** Full support for Python code reviews.
- **JavaScript:** Review and optimize your JavaScript code.
- **Java:** Insights into Java code quality and improvement.
- **C++:** C++ code review with performance and readability tips.
✅ **Code Optimization Suggestions:** Receive actionable suggestions to enhance your code’s performance.
✅ **Code Clarity and Structure:** Improve the organization and readability of your code with structured recommendations.
✅ **Security Considerations:** Identify potential security risks and weaknesses, along with recommended fixes.
✅ **Documentation and Comments:** Ensure your code is well-documented with helpful comments for maintainability.
✅ **Testing and Coverage:** Assess test coverage and provide feedback to enhance test cases and coverage.
✅ **Style Consistency:** Keep your code style consistent throughout, ensuring readability and maintainability.
✅ **Compliance with Coding Standards:** Ensure adherence to best coding practices.
✅ **Time and Space Complexity Analysis:** Analyze your code’s performance in terms of time and space efficiency.
✅ **Final Recommendation:** Receive a summary with the overall health of the code, highlighting areas for improvement.

💡 **Technologies Used:**
- **Google Cloud’s Gemini-1.5-Flash model:** The foundation of the AI, enabling smart code analysis and suggestions.
- **Streamlit:** Building a clean, interactive web interface for a seamless user experience.
- **google.generativeai:** Leveraging advanced generative AI for intelligent code review insights.

🎯 **Why It Matters:** Saral’s Code Reviewer empowers developers to:
🚀 Catch bugs and security issues faster.
🚀 Optimize code for improved performance.
🚀 Maintain a clean, consistent codebase.
🚀 Refactor code for long-term maintainability.

This project is a great demonstration of how generative AI can transform the way we approach code reviews and help developers create high-quality, efficient software.

🌟 **Check out the project on GitHub!**
👉 [https://lnkd.in/g2mFgqaQ](https://lnkd.in/g2mFgqaQ)

**Let’s Connect!** If you’re passionate about AI in Software Development, I’d love to hear your thoughts, suggestions, or feedback on this project. Feel free to reach out if you'd like to explore the tool further! 🚀

#AI #GenerativeAI #SoftwareDevelopment #CodeReview #MachineLearning #AIinTech #TechInnovation #DeveloperTools #Programming #Python #JavaScript #Java #C++ #AItools

🌟 Exciting Highlights from Azure AI & Developer Day 🌟

🤖 I had the privilege of attending the Azure AI & Developer Day on August 2, 2024, at the Microsoft Sovereign Office. This enlightening event was supported by the Azure Developer Community and Microsoft Azure and expertly managed by Reskilll. The day was filled with invaluable insights into the future of AI and development. 🌐

💡 Mr. Naman Bansal Sir kicked off the event with an engaging session on the evolution of AI. He provided a comprehensive overview of Generative AI, Large Language Models, Vector Embeddings, Auto Gen, and Multi-Agent Frameworks. His in-depth insights on ChatGPT and the exponential boom in AI technology were particularly enlightening. Additionally, he introduced us to the fundamentals and advanced concepts of Prompt Engineering, enhancing our understanding of effective interactions with AI models. 🤖

💻 Mr. Brijender Ahuja Sir followed with a captivating demonstration of GitHub Copilot. He showcased efficient coding techniques and the real-world applications of Generative AI in coding through a hands-on demo. His insights on leveraging GitHub Copilot to optimize development processes were incredibly valuable. 🚀

🔍 The discussion on Responsible AI by both speakers was a highlight, focusing on crucial aspects like fairness, accountability, privacy, and security. This topic emphasized the importance of ethical considerations in AI development. 📊

🎓 The event concluded with a fun and interactive quiz, reinforcing our learning and sparking engaging discussions. 🧠

👥 I was glad to attend this event with Harshdeep Malhotra, Saksham Wadhwa, Vedaant Arora, and Divyam Babbar. We were delighted to reconnect with Anushka Jain there. This experience significantly broadened our perspectives and provided us with actionable insights to implement in our future projects. 🤝

🙏 A huge thank you to the organizers, speakers, and all participants for making this event a resounding success. Looking forward to leveraging these learnings to drive innovation and efficiency in our work. 🌟

#AzureAI #Networking #GenerativeAI #GitHubCopilot #MicrosoftAzure

🚀 I recently attended the Onchain India Program at the Masters' Union School of Business. Hosted by Base and Levitate Labs, this event delved deep into the fascinating world of blockchain and Web3. 🌐🔗

🧠 The Onchain India Program aimed to unite the brightest minds in the Indian Web3 community. It was an incredible experience connecting with passionate developers, experienced entrepreneurs, and enthusiastic individuals dedicated to building the future of Web3. ✨

📚 We explored the foundations of Bitcoin and Ethereum, learning how various blockchain technologies interconnect to facilitate seamless transactions. Additionally, we gained insights into Smart Contracts, APIs, blockchain gaming and their operational mechanisms on the blockchain. 🔍

🏢 Special thanks to the developers from companies like Humanity Protocol, LEVELQ, bitsCrunch, Dojima Foundation, CoinSwitch and Ambrus Studio who played a pivotal role in making this event a success. 💡

🤝 I had the pleasure of attending this event with Harshdeep Malhotra, Saksham Wadhwa, Divyam Babbar, and Vedaant Arora. The vibrant discussions and networking opportunities were truly invaluable. 🎉

💼 Kudos to the organizers and partners for an insightful and well-organized event. Looking forward to leveraging these learnings and contributing to the future of Web3! 🚀

#Blockchain #Web3 #OnchainIndia #Networking #FutureTech

I recently had an insightful conversation with my mentors at work, one that left me reflecting deeply.

The discussion revolved around where I could add the most value given my experience, learnings, and aspirations. That’s when they turned to me and said, “You need to start thinking like an entrepreneur, not just a leader.” For a moment, I paused, letting the weight of those words sink in.

All my life, I’ve been told to strive to be a leader, not a manager. And now, here I was, hearing something entirely different—be an entrepreneur, not just a leader. The shift in perspective was subtle yet profound.

When you align yourself deeply with business goals, leadership tends to emerge naturally. But when you begin to see yourself not just as a contributor but as a cornerstone of the business, everything changes. Titles, structures, and teams become secondary. You start to operate like a business owner—invested, unafraid, and ready to tackle challenges head-on, without being tethered to past achievements or the comforts of legacy.

It’s about embodying the mindset of a founder—absorbing their relentless drive, their expansive vision, their ability to build, rebuild, and move forward without attachment. It’s not about basking in what you’ve already created, nor about claiming the fruits of your past efforts. It’s about embracing the uncertainty of starting from scratch over and over again, giving it everything you have, and then letting go to move on to the next challenge.

This mindset is not for the faint-hearted. It demands resilience, a willingness to embrace discomfort, and an insatiable curiosity to explore uncharted paths. Yet, it’s enriching in ways that few other journeys can be. It transforms not just what you do, but who you are.

And perhaps that’s the ultimate growth—to think beyond roles and titles and to step into the shoes of an entrepreneur, ready to shape the future.

#womenintech #problemsolver #lambdatest

Asad Khan Jay Singh Maneesh Sharma

Some of the most common objections I hear all day, every day are either logical or emotional.

Some of the emotional ones are:

 • I am busy!
 • Is this a sales call?
 • Not interested!

Logical ones include:

 • We already have a system in place.
 • I’m not the right point of contact.
 • We don’t have the budget or bandwidth.

Most reps confuse the two. The smart ones understand the difference and respond appropriately. When the person is emotionally charged, you shouldn’t cater to logic, and vice versa :)

#outbound #saas #sales #pipeline

One of the most powerful strategies in outbound sales is ABM, when planned and executed correctly.

 • The process often breaks when marketing and sales are not aligned, and both teams work in silos.

 • Your sales leader is not taking full ownership of end-to-end execution.

 • Reporting metrics are vague or overlapping.

 • There’s no solid communication between teams.

 • You have a poor system for maintaining CRM hygiene, leading to unorganized data and insights.

This requires both analytical and creative skill sets from sales and marketing teams to keep data fresh, relevant, and hyper-personalized—focusing on personas to build relationships and make them aware of problems they may not even know they have.

#saas #abm #sales #demandgen

Why Representation in Leadership Matters!

This is one topic which everyone talks about but few actually put in the effort for it. Why is that? It takes hard work, empathy, time, a secured peer, and a true leader to support and ensure women representation in management.

I often get feedback that managers shy away from hiring female resources, especially in sales, as they find it difficult to work with them under pressure and deliver desired outcomes.

My only advice to one and all is to prioritize your career in the early years and surround yourself with the right friends, managers, and leaders. Else, the road to success is already hard, but it will be the hardest.

In my early career, I often felt pressured to fit into the ‘bro culture’ of male-dominated leadership. I often found myself being the only woman in a room full of male leaders. It’s hard to admit, but I used to emulate male leaders, trying to fit in and not end up losing equal opportunities. I’m sharing this because I know I am not the only one. This is why representation matters, especially in tech and sales.

I found success when I decided to be my true self—vulnerable, honest, empathetic. It was a hard transition, but worth it. This is still a work in progress for me, and I owe much to my husband, mentor, and peers who have supported me. I’m learning every day to be more successful and less exhausted.

This is why diverse representation in leadership is vital. When leaders reflect different backgrounds and experiences, no one feels they need to conform to outdated norms or feel the need to hide their true selves to succeed. Let’s stop apologizing for who we are and create spaces where everyone can thrive authentically.

#Leadership #Diversity #Authenticity #WomenInLeadership

In the rush to automate, it's easy to fall into the AI trap, chasing automation just because it's trendy. But let’s be strategic. When should we truly look at AI to solve sales problems without sacrificing the essence of sales?

The key lies in quality over quantity. If you're prioritizing broad reach without any data-backed relevancy, you're veering into marketer territory, focusing on brand awareness. Sales, on the other hand, is about relationship building and funnel optimization.

AI should enhance our ability to score signals, but the execution—timing and quality conversations—should be left to salespeople.

Spraying prospects with constant outreach to come for a meeting will only increase lead burn rates. Effective sales leverage all channels efficiently, not just one. This is where managers and leaders play a critical and irreplaceable role. As we adopt more AI, their role in training and guiding reps becomes even more critical.

Let’s avoid the AI trap. Use AI to support, not replace, the human touch in sales.

#Sales #AITrap #QualityOverQuantity #Leadership #SalesTraining #RelationshipBuilding

One of the coolest things I’ve learned about sales in a startup is the importance of the founder in creating the first sales playbook. 🧩

The founder has a unique understanding of the vision, a deep clarity about the problem the product is solving, and an innate sense of the target audience. It’s crucial to have this playbook ready and thoroughly tested with your outbound strategy even before hiring your first salesperson.

The Sales Playbook is a living document that evolves with the market. The founding team is always the first to learn and implement these changes. It’s incredibly enriching to see founders dedicated to sharing and practicing their learnings with their teams every quarter.

Working at LambdaTest has been a truly fulfilling experience. 🚀

#Sales #StartupLife #SalesPlaybook #Founders #LambdaTest Jay Singh

Power of email communication is often misused and overlooked -

- Cut, copy and paste from AI tools is becoming the norm. Ugh! That’s my pet peeve. I mean who talks like this - In the realm of digital era..

- Starting your email with exchanging pleasantries. I hope you are doing well.. blah blah. That’s so outdated. Keep this towards the end of your email

- Not using your research about prospect’s tech stack or any other relevant insight in your opener. Cut the fluff

- Lengthy subject lines not optimised for mobile reading

- Bad formatting. Ugh! That’s a big turnoff for the reader

- Giving in the temptation to provide every possible detail about your company. Keep it simple and short

- I have seen emails where sender’s signature ends up taking more space than the content itself. I mean come on, that’s a crime

- Last but not the least, folks giving absolutely no attention to the emails going out from their id and being highly irresponsible. They should be banned from email communication. Period.

- Read your email atleast twice before hitting send

From outbound standpoint, with all of the new regulations, aggressive cold calls, the sense of giving space and time to prospect will prevail and one could potentially maximise lead generation through e-mail outreach.

Self improvement is the key to success here. Happy writing :)

#email #outbound #sales #marketing

I came across the term "macro neglected" recently.

It got me thinking about my learnings over the last few years -

For all aspiring managers and leaders, one of the most important skills that you will ever need for building a high-performing team is understanding whom to "micro-manage" and whom not to entirely "macro-neglect."

As managers, our instinct is often to oversee every detail and be involved in every decision and conversation. But trust me, the moment you learn to pick your battles wisely and give your team the autonomy they need, you’ll see a remarkable boost in productivity and morale.

Here's the key: Identify the team members who thrive with more freedom and those who need a bit more guidance. Empower your top performers by stepping back and letting them shine. For those who need closer supervision, provide it in a supportive way.

By resisting the urge to fix what doesn’t need fixing and giving your team the space to grow, you’ll foster trust and confidence across the board.

Make the choice today to lead with intention and see your team's success soar! 🚀

#Leadership #SalesLeadership #TeamProductivity #Empowerment #ManagementTips

A lot of founders/leaders that I talk to often ask me how leading large global teams, especially one with a vibrant mix of interns and seasoned professionals has changed me over time and how do I do it?

And I always tell them, it’s a collaborative journey. Every day, I’m reminded that success is a team effort, fueled by the unwavering support of peers, bosses, and the incredible individuals I have the privilege to lead.

But Man! Does it get tough? Do I have bad days? Do I lose my shit when things are delayed and deadlines loom? Is it daunting to navigate diverse personalities? YES, one hundred percent! But what truly keeps me going -

- Ability to listen and be proactive in conflict resolution. It’s about hearing every voice and ensuring every concern is addressed with fairness and empathy. I have realised sometimes all it takes is lending an empathetic ear to resolve conflicts and reassure team members.

- Passion and self-drive to leave a lasting legacy and encourage others to dream big! This keeps me going even on my toughest days.

- Financial independence, nothing can beat this satisfaction.

- Meeting new people and diving into uncharted territories keeps me energized literally every day.

- Seeking help from peers, management, and team. Being vocal about needs, issues, and collective solutions ensures there is trust and transparency.

- Being genuinely invested in an individual’s growth even if it comes at your own expense. Going out of the way to make things happen for them - This is a non-negotiable for me.

I am so consumed by work that there are times when I can’t even recall who I am without it. I am sure many of you would relate with me :)

Cheers to embracing this journey and leaving a legacy worth celebrating!

#sales #leadership #growthmindset

Are deep reference checks still relevant?

Yes, absolutely! I've learned firsthand the critical importance of ensuring that every member of your leadership team is not just qualified on paper, but truly the right fit for your organization's vision and values.

Over my more than a decade-long career, I've seen companies with solid teams, strong cultures, and impressive products crumble because of one fatal flaw: hiring the wrong leaders. It's the difference between success and failure, between growth and stagnation.

So how do we solve this dilemma?

Deep, confidential ref checks are paramount.

Anyone who you are hiring can easily leave a good impression on you based on the ranks they have covered and experience that they carry, but how did they navigate tough situations? How did they handle cross-team conflicts? These insights can only come from different reference checks (direct boss, peer, reportee).

Additionally, I've found that taking the time for relaxed, informal meetings – perhaps over lunch or dinner – with potential hires can be incredibly revealing. It's in these settings that you can gauge not just their professional skills, but their character, their values, and their fit with your company.

If your confidence is growing after each meeting, then trust your instinct and bring them on board. However, if your confidence is shrinking meeting after meeting, then you just dodged a potential disaster.

#Leadership #ReferenceChecks #SalesSuccess #Hiring

I'm soon to mark two rewarding years with LambdaTest.

I would like to share a few things that truly make LambdaTest different from many SaaS companies in our ecosystem!

First and foremost, our culture isn't just a buzzword thrown around during interviews. I have often seen and heard stories about how companies discuss their culture during interviews, emphasizing its importance but then delegating its execution to ONE team.

Now let me tell you what most of us have experienced at LambdaTest. Here, we are all involved in execution! It is so top-down that you just cannot ignore it. And it changes the whole game.

Everyone is motivated and knows what they are doing, and what impact it creates on the business and our customers. This is so endearing that you want to wake up, dress up, show up at work, and give your best every single time!

We talk openly about issues, resolutions, what’s working, and what’s not working. There is no place for delusion.
I personally hate deluded people. That’s not my cup of tea.

I sometimes get feedback that we are stringent with our hiring. Yes, we are strict with our hiring and hold people accountable, but that’s how you disrupt the market and build a top-notch company within a few years against all odds in a highly competitive market.

We are an execution-focused company. Yes, we keep everyone from founders to leaders to ICs on their toes and don’t settle for mediocrity.

On that note, we have organized an in-person event with our leaders and top industry speakers to share their learnings about how you can impact your and your team’s productivity with new-age methods, solving traditional problems with the latest tech and approach.

A great opportunity to learn and grow together! Sometimes, one day can change your life and for some of you, this could be that day!
Save the date - 9th May 2024 (Virtual)

Chandni Chopra Asad Khan Jay Singh Maneesh Sharma

#sales #aiinsales #demandgeneration #career #thoughtleadership #outbound #inbound #accountmanagement #customersuccess #culture #events

AI this, AI that!

To a point where it all seems like living in a limbo.

With abundance of information and trends available on internet, it is easy to get lost.

Pretty much similar when it comes to skin care and fitness, it got me so confused that I couldn’t decide whether I should start my day with ACV or celery juice or lemon water or ash gourd juice as all of these are meant to be taken on an empty stomach first thing 😂

And then months later after going on and off, I just kinda realised to each to its own. Listen to your body and voila!

Well today, AI in SaaS is no different.

There are plenty of products trying to solve some or the other problem for you. Some are trying to solve the problems that don’t even exist. Every company is using AI in some way or another.

But what actually works and has shown results?

Well if you are finding yourself in the middle of AI revolution, then a potential good start could be with our tried and tested learnings to boost your SaaS sales engine.

Based on the feedback received from different leaders and sales communities, we are coming up with a new event with complete focus on AI in Sales.

Saahil Menoki, Rahul Wadhwa 🦄 and I along with other leaders will be your hosts, and share our experiences with what’s working for us and what you can definitely skip ;)

Please find details in the comments section.

PS: This event is even more beneficial for new leaders or folks transitioning into a senior role as this directly impacts your KPI - Increase your team’s productivity and efficiency.

#LambdaTestYourApps #sales #saas #learning #ai #networking #salesenablement #hunting #closing

As I embark on my enhanced role and embrace more responsibilities at LambdaTest. I'm thrilled to play a part in advancing our global presence even further by solving tough testing problems for Quality Engineering teams. Here's a look at the factors that have led me to where I am today.

- Nothing in this world is so important for you to take so much pressure and mess up your mental peace. I stay calm and this allows me to be able to think clearly and take actions.

- Leadership navigation is a SKILL. It comes with experience. No one in the WORLD can teach you that. What really helps is finding the right mentor. Actually, they find you ;) A right mentor is someone who has an influence to make you ascend the success ladder. Rest, what you seek from your friends, family, and others is advice. Do not confuse between the two. Mentorship takes effort and time. You can even take up their job but mentors are never insecure. They nurture you instead. Leaders BUILD Leaders.

- I killed my EGO long time ago. The only leadership that is indisposable is the one which has a buy-in from the team, can help unblock them swiftly.

- I am a highly ambitious, tenacious and self driven person and I work my ass off to do my job with 100% sincerity and focus. I always tell my team - have guts to find your glory. Have a purpose in life and then do everything possible to make that distant dream turn into reality. Sky is the limit!

One thing that has worked like magic for me is the ability to take feedback and work actively on fixing gaps. Other thing is to have faith in myself and be the best version of myself each and every day.

PS - This is straight from my heart. I wish to see more and more women in leadership. I will do my bit and continue sharing my experiences. We definitely don’t get it easy but that’s a story for some other day :)

#lambdatestyourapps #womenintech #leadership #techsales #b2bsales #demandgen #saas

Some unadulterated thoughts on customer success.

Retention is an outcome and is not the only factor of 'product adoption'. Rather, the entire post-sales cycle is responsible for it.

I have often seen companies attributing Customer Success job to JUST product adoption metric. However, the role of a CS person is not just that. It goes much beyond this only metric. 

A client invests in your product not to just use your product but to solve their pain point and your product happens to be just one piece of the solution. And in some cases, the switching cost is low, and for others it's high. Hence, the role of a CS person requires having a holistic understanding of the business, what outcomes the client is expecting, what exactly will move the needle, and then put together these pieces to ensure how positively it will impact their KRAs.

Believe me, this is what will give you an opportunity to have leadership buy-in and that’s what will make you irreplaceable. So, it's not your product but how well you understand their business objectives and align it with the outcomes of using your platform.

#customersuccess #strategy #retentionstrategy #growth

Recently, I had a maddening experience with my broadband vendor. It went like this:

I got on a call with the first (A) agent, he listened to my query, politely asked me to wait on the line then ghosted. Nevertheless, I called again, different agent (B) attended my call, listened carefully, and then asked me to wait and transferred my call to another agent (C) who proceeded to ask me the same questions again. He then suggested to allow him 24 hours. It went on and on for a few days where I had to start all over again from scratch. Now imagine this in SaaS where someone chose you over others.

One of the most common mistakes that we make is not to have an effective and clearly laid out process for sales handover. The process of handing over the relationship with your customers from one part of the sales team to the next is a vulnerable point of transition similar to what we experience in a relay race with no finish line. If not done right, we can (and often do) completely drop the ball and set the relationship with the customer up for massive failure right out of the gate.

In a highly competitive space, the companies that can foster and nurture more of these relationships than their competitors will always have high retention fuel the growth. #sales #customersuccess #handover

Everyone is doing their bit to make sense of remote work. For some, it's the convenience like no travel time, work from woods, aligning your day-to-day priorities, focusing on fitness, etc. For others, it feels very monotonous and challenging as lines get blurred between home and work—seems like you are working in silos, no tea breaks with office gossip, no fun banter. It gets difficult to navigate your way, and there is a constant pressure to make yourself visible somehow.

Well, in the midst of all this, I would highly recommend that instead of relying on other teams or HR to make remote work easy for you, please come out of your bubble and start being accountable. E.g., start keeping aside tea breaks and regular lunch/dinner times where you strictly do not talk about work.

I organized one such catch-up today with my team, and it felt so refreshing! It was amazing to get to know them on a personal level—we talked about everything under the sun :D

At Airmeet, we take the culture bit quite seriously and have really interesting ways to keep teams motivated and engaged. A huge credit goes to managers/leaders who do not have a tendency to micromanage everything and trust their hiring and team.

Vignesh Maneesh Aakarshan Oshin Sunny

#remoteculture #teamcollaboration #airmeet

Stakeholder Management is one of the key challenges when you are starting up in a leadership role.

Things that I have learned in my career so far:

1) Have razor-sharp focus on the key problem you are trying to solve. It's easy to get lost trying to solve multiple problems. Have clarity about the value that you want to deliver

2) Keep weekly syncs with each key stakeholder

3) Keep them in the loop by sending weekly progress reports

4) Write short emails with crisp summaries. Have links to detailed documentation or WIP Strategy doc

5) Make as many connections as possible and invest time in learning about the industry/market trends in general

6) Understand the impact of the problem you are trying to solve in quantifiable terms

7) Be strong in voicing your opinion and receiving feedback

8) Last but not the least, learn and unlearn things fast

It is tough but it's a skill you can't do without.

What are some of the things you've done to manage key stakeholders in your company?

#leadership #management #strategy #career

Working with founders and CXOs directly is another ball game altogether. Because they don't want to hear excuses.

If you are in that position where there are no layers in between, a lot is at stake for you, for them, and the business. However, learning will be through the roof.

Few tips that will come in handy:

1) When a problem is thrown at you. First, MARRY the problem, and understand it fully before jumping on solutions

2) Manage your time effectively and stay on top of things. Always go prepared before your meeting and ensure you share meeting minutes

3) Do not expect appreciation and a pat on your back as often as you are used to while working with managers. You need to be 100% self-motivated

4) If you have screwed up something, admit your mistake, fix it and get shit done. Remember the "no excuse mantra"

5) Be honest and easy to approach, and invest time in building a good relationship with peers

6) ALWAYS stay connected with customers to know the ground reality, firsthand

I would say, it's a golden opportunity, so go out with all your heart, read, talk and learn from other leaders, peers, and juniors. And most importantly, enjoy the process :)

Bonus Tip: When they ask you to get something done. Never ask, "when". Share the next steps and timeline :D

#leadership #leaders #building #founders

As a company grows, leaders obsess over New Business.

Marketing teams get huge budgets. Sales get deep incentives.

The customer success function takes a backseat. It feels weird to spend money on a customer you already have instead of attracting a new one.

However, without 100%+ revenue retention, there is no way the business would see hockey stick growth.

This is called the New Business Bias.

Here are some of the things that leaders could do to avoid the trap of the new business bias:

1) Invest time in hiring and building your CS function early on. Don't wait to hit a certain million milestone

2) Have your CS leader report into the CEO instead of Sales head. Otherwise, the focus ends up being on revenue instead of pushing the customer to the next step in their customer journey.

3) Incentivize CS function based on clearly defined key responsibilities - Retention and Expansion - to drive razor sharp focus

4) Have clear rules of engagement. Clearly lay out who is responsible and accountable in different scenarios.

5) Make time to listen to your customers everyday. Talk to at least 2-3 customers. Listen in to calls on Gong or Clari Copilot. Share learnings and discuss with your team every week.

6) As companies grow, positioning changes as the target audience evolves. Every time this change is made, a gap is seen on the ground. Spend time updating playbooks, communicating changes thoroughly and providing feedback on calls. A mere email on the changes is not enough.

The above things will ensure your new business bias is in check. Your revenue function is healthy and your revenue growth is ready to skyrocket.

Any tips you would like to add to the above?

#growth #customersuccess #accountmanagement #saas #leadership #change #hiring #founders

Feedback and Feedforward!! Time to unblock your team.

Traditional styles of management will not work anymore. As leaders you have to be on your toes, continuously feeding forward to your team about what might not work, what might work, stand not behind, not in front but with them.

Give space to bring their own creativity, encourage cross-team learnings, help them to market their hard work, make work more fun with monthly "lunch and learn" concepts, know them beyond what they bring to work.

If the company is in the aggressive growing phase, all functions will get micro-managed as a lot of things are at stake.

Consistent below-average performers will get called out, people who are not accountable, and self-motivated will find it hard to cope with the pace with which the company is moving.

But if there is one thing that I have learned, your hustle and positive mindset is what holds the power to change your destiny.

The hustle from taking things 0 to 1 (think of it like an incubation phase), making it 1 to 100 will be easier than this. As by this time, you have the playbooks, you know what works, what doesn't, the engine starts working on its own.

But for this to work, leaders and the team on the ground need to work like hand in glove, a small miss can potentially derail you from your goals.

People who survive and hustle their way through this phase turn out to be the best version of themselves. They are like rare diamonds who always bring out the best in their team, have strong affirmation and go on to become strong leaders.

#executionmanagement #management #sales #outbound #hustleculture #mindset #leaders

Never forget the one who gives you a deserving title and paycheck.

My friend and I were having an interesting conversation about how passionate people are overthinkers. How should they manage their anxiety, stakeholder navigation, work-life balance!

I think some of the things that could help -

1) Take out your diary and start writing whatever is on your mind when you are thrown into any uncertain situation

2) Don’t be in a hurry. Ensure you stay focused on your core job

3) Consciously give it time and let things unfold at their own pace. Hold your horses

4) Get clarity, focus on the bigger picture, and align yourself and your team with one objective—company’s growth. Nothing else! This must always be the focus.

Change is constant and that’s how it should be. The idea is to keep growing and learning with a positive attitude and a healthy life.

Let me know your thoughts or learnings!

#leadership #growthmindset #passionatepeople #changemanagement
